lines.text: Pssssst! Maggie!

[Maggie looks out the window, leans out a little, then looks down and sees Oliver on the remaining block of the broken wall planter below]
What are you doing?

[smiles tiredly]
I've come to rescue you!

[looks behind her, then back to Oliver]
Don't rescue me, it's a trap!
Sweet, sweet Maggie! I know it's a Goddamned trap! The point is, I've somewhat bungled things. So... you're gonna have to save me.

[stands upright, crossing arms]
Are you safe on that thing?
Define safe.

[Turns around hastily, pulls the sheets off the bed, ties them into a long rope and ties it around herself hastily, prepared to lower it down to Oliver]
Allright! I'll save your life! That's only fair, you saved mine! But then I'm calling it quits!
Why?
Because you have no respect for my feelings!
I have respect for your feelings...
Bull Shit!
I get the feeling you don't believe me?
Stop being charming!
I haven't got much choice right now, I got a 50 foot drop below me, and a crazy lady 10 feet above!
After we... After we did... After we were done with...
After sex?
Yes! Right! Correct! You could have got the number yourself, you didn't have to
[chokes back tears]
throw your wife at me!
I don't have a wife.
I saw the wedding photo!
That's my sister!
[Oliver starts to get aggravated]
Don't make it worse!

[yelling]
Now you listen to me, Margaret! When I first met you, you were this... beautiful, crazy... ragamuffin. And I said to myself, hey! A beautiful, crazy... ragamuffin! I didn't have to fly down to get the bottle, I volunteered! Now why do you think I did that?
Why should I believe any of this?

[sighs, frustrated and looks around, motioning with his hand]
A guy fresh from the chiropractor scales a 50 foot wall to save your life? This is not mass entertainment Maggie! It's gotta be... Love!
What?
You heard me...
Well, a woman wants to hear it as loudly... and as frequently... as possible!

[lowers his voice]
I love you. Okay? I'm hopelessly and completely in love with you.
[raises his voice]
And that's all you're gonna get for now!

[lowers the make-shift rope to Oliver]
Grab hold, I'll pull!
Are you sure you're strong enough?
I've waited for you all of my life, Oliver Plexico! I'm not about to lose you now!

[Sir Mason and Richard are discussing the winery's business dealings. Margaret has come in after cleaning up from the last tasting]
Everything is cleaned up, Father.
Thank you, Margaret.
[Margaret remains where she is, Sir Mason looks up]
Yes? Is there something else, my dear?
Father, please, when will I be able to go on an outing?
Margaret, we've discussed this...

[interrupts]
Father, wines are my life. I love it! And I am passed up time and time again while Richard gets every opportunity!
The wine business is complex, certaintly not for a silly girl!
You are a person of very little character!
You know what pains me, Margaret?
Fat men in high heels?
No! What a bitter, lonely old maid you are going to be!
Enough of this! Both of you! Margaret, I said I would send you out when you are ready, and as I am in charge of this winery, until I feel you are, Richard will continue to represent our interests.
When?
When you are *ready*, dear!
So that's your final word, then?
Yes.
I thought you might say that. Here
[puts a letter on the desk]
What's this?
My resignation letter.

[Picks up the letter and starts to read it]
Well, this *is* good news.

[takes the letter from Richard]
When your mother decided to raise you in America, I accepted it. It was a decision I always knew would come to back to haunt me. But this
[holds the letter up]
, you stop it now. Or I shall, I assure you, become quite upset.
[holds the letter out to Margaret, which she does not take back]
I don't enjoy making threats very well.
Neither do I. Goodbye.
[turns and walks out]

[throws the letter on the desk]
Damn! Truly, truly, Damn!
Father, we should celebrate her leaving!
Celebrate? She knows more about wine than you'll ever know, and she willingly does the work of four!
But Harwood has never been represented by a *woman*!
Son of a bitch!
Exactly!

[In a poorly-done Scottish accent]
Upon further review, this has proven to be a potential clue and must be returned to the... uh... castle.
Yeah, right, that's a clue, you're a police inspector and I'm Herve Villechaize!
What?
You know, the little guy on "Fantasy Island"?

[to Richard, after Margaret has given her resignation about not being able to represent the winery]
Yes. Well, I suppose we'll have to change that.
[goes out after Margaret]
Margaret! Enough of this!
[Margaret stops and turns around, wiping tears from her eyes]
A lawyer friend of mine acts for an estate in Scotland, on the Isle of Skye. His client, an absentee landlord, has recently died, and this lawyer has asked me to dispose of the wine cellar.
[hands Margaret a package]
The legal documents are all in here.
Oh, thank you, Father!
[throws her arms around her father]
I swear, I won't disappoint you!

[hugs Margaret, and quickly breaks the embrace]
Well, that's quite enough sentiment for one day, Margaret.
[smiles. Margaret grins and nods, Sir Mason turns to walk back inside. As Margaret turns and walks away, Sir Mason looks back in the direction of his daughter and smiles again, then goes back inside]
